result.execSummary:
The defendant Keontae L Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC AMENDED FROM PCS W/INTENT THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain GED or HSED.  Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

DOC-notice of court ordered financial obligations status - balance due on court ordered financial obligations $400.43.  Defendant due to discharge 05/05/2015.
Defendant does not plan on seeking postconviction relief.

Defendant Keontae L Howard in court with attorney Erin J Larsen.   Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Stipulated agreement to 3 counts of Misd THC. probation and 100 hours CSW
P-NC to all
COP filed, rights given

finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. Sent w/held - 1 yr probation. Deft may motion for expungement if deft completes probation and remains crime free for 2 years after completion of same.

costs

any counseling deemed approp by agent

allowing defendant to attend school at Turning Point Academy
Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 21, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Keontae L Howard in court with attorney Erin J Larsen.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams for Rebecca Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Offer has been made. Name should be spelled Keyontae  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:     Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court and meeting with atty. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Keontae L Howard in court with attorney Michelle M Anderson.  Defendant Keontae L Howard in custody.  Sharon A Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
